name: Hotel du Vin & Bistro Newcastle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are immaculate, modern and comfortable. The staff are polite and friendly and bend over backwards to accommodate your every need! It is on the outskirts of the city - 15 mins walk to the central city centre but only costs £2-£3 in a taxi. Its a quiet location so you have luxury and peace but within minutes to the hustle and bustle.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Rooms are great but if you want a really special room, upgrade to a mezzanine suite - fantastic
reviews.title: Wonderful in every aspect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Outdoor area is fantastic. Food and drinks are top class.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing lacking was that there is no gym however you can use the gym at their sister hotel the malmaison.
reviews.title: Without doubt, one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: For lovers of the Hotel du Vin concept you won't be disappionted here. Developed in a former shipbuilder's office overlooking the Tyne, it is stylish and intimate with very knowledgable and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel & restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent dinner and the chef was very helpful in providing gluten free dishes for one of our guests (marking on the menu which dishes could be provided). The kitchen is open to the restaurant and we were fascinated and reassured to see the thorough clean-up which went on after service. The bar is intimate and provides a great selection of local bottled beers (as well as the usual wines).
reviews.title: You HAVE to go to the bar. And the restaurant. And the...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only potential downside is the location which is well away from the city centre in an area currently being re-developed. Some people might find the slightly quieter location just right but it will encourage us to stay somewhere else next time, probably at the fabulaously located Malmaison Hotel further down the river (owned by the same group).
reviews.title: Comfort and quiet beside the Tyne.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This really is one of those places that you will recount to your friends again and again. The food is exceptional to the point of inappropriate groans of delight at the dinner table. The staff are superb- nothing is too much effort, but more than that each of them is passionate about their job and lovely too.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great staff, smashing breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: We can honestly say we've have never had such amazing cocktails. Put the bar list away and ask 'The Maestro' John to make you something divine. He'll design you a drink so mind-blowing you'll never want to leave the bar let alone the Hotel. Ever. He's like a child in a sweet shop, buzzing with excitement and passion, and makes drinks so unique you'll spend the whole evening sampling the most delicious cocktails around.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and rooms, but worth the price? You decide....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times (about 10 stays in the last 2 years) in a variety of rooms and I have always enjoyed my stay.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Newcastle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Near the quayside. Great.
reviews.title: Fabulous - will definitely return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking: Always manage to park on a section by the main road, its definately not a designated car park but I never have a problem parking there.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: Always friendly. Keep a record of previous visits and often give deals and free upgrades on quiet days (very much appreciated).
reviews.title: Brilliant, as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Price: Rooms are always around £120. Well-priced. When full they can also check vacancies at the nearby Malmaison but I prefer the service here.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Situated in the former home of the 'Tyne Tee's Shipping company' Du vin's Newcastle offering 'seemed' to be a bit out of town for my liking but I was wrong. Housed in an impressive red brick building Du Vin proved to be only a short stroll to Newcastles rejuvenated quay side area. The groups trade mark Cigar Shack stands central in a nicely set out enclosed court yard which would no doubt be a haven in the summer. Our room was imaculate ! and sported a roll top bath in the bedroom and a huge walk in shower in the bathroom. Can't fault the staff and the breakfast was very good..... just how it should be. Top marks
reviews.title: Du Vin rings all the right bells !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: simply amazing.
reviews.title: i wouldnt stay anywhere else in Newcastle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we stayed in the mezzanine room, although of course not the cheapest place in Newcastle, this was simply the most relaxed place to stay.
reviews.title: Looked lovely, friendly staff but failed to meet expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: location is out of town but only a 15minute walk into the city centre so not at all a problem.
reviews.title: Back Again - still a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is intimate and well organised, check in was simple and stress free.
reviews.title: Immense, perfect from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be one of the nicest hotel rooms we've ever stayed in. Nice view from our rooftop terrace across the Tyne and a beautiful roll top bath we sadly didnt have time to use.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, strange location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very clean which you would expect from this trendy brand and really spacious.
reviews.title: 90% there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town centre is walking distance in the daytime for any able bodied person (approx 20 mins). Or a bus ride away caught 2 mins away from hotel. Not exactly walking distance home though if you're visiting the bright lights of the city .
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: The bar was nice and the breakfast was one of the best!
reviews.title: We recommend the hotel but not the bistro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Not exactly a central location but worth a visit.
reviews.title: Another impressive stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend, large walk in shower enclosure with separate free standing bath. Bed was very comfortable and the fixtures and fittings twinned with the ambient lighting made the place feel very special. We enjoyed 1 evening meal there and this was excellent, the breakfasts were also very good. Staff were very helpful. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Stylish and great quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had the great fortune to stay in the Hotel du Vin in Newcastle, which was absolutely perfect in every way - very friendly staff, incredibly comfortable bed, wonderfully deep bath. Brilliant value for money and exactly what was needed after running to Newcastle from Carlisle...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in the Toon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was great too - my steak was cooked perfectly and brought to my room as I couldn't face hobbling to the bistro! And the breakfast muesli/granola was second to none - I have asked for the recipe!
reviews.title: Just Super

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Although this hotel has a stunning location, lovely rooms , and a really excellent restaurant, what makes it outstanding are the staff and management that run it. The friendly greeting at reception,
reviews.title: Great accommodation
First-class
reviews.text: the cheerful bar staff and the attentive service in the restaurant just showed that the staff and management here really cared. Just super.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hotel du Vin on a Sunday night (when the hotel often has an excellent deal where you can stay from just £25 if you spend £75 in the Bistro). We upgraded to a maisonette style room which is on two levels. The room was fantastic and very comfortable. The bathroom was very different being on the upper level with a roll top bath and huge walk in shower. The bathroom is almost on a balcony looking over the bedroom. We ate in the bistro and the food was of a very high standard and the Chef was actively speaking to customers and very happy to take special requests. The staff in the Bar were also very kind and great company (especially Paris) and the young man who was on late, who’s name I forget who made an excellent espresso martini. Sundays tend to be quite in the hotel and I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to stay for a special occasion / or who is looking for a hotel that is something a bit different and special.
reviews.title: Excellent 1st Class Hotel - Fantastic Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here a few times with my partner, we have dined here twice and the food is of high quality and local produce. The staff are friendly and professional and give great service!! The rooms are beautifully furnished and have a nice cozy feel to them and also are big and spacious! The bar is a bit quiet and i prefer the atmosphere of the Malmaison but much prefer the rooms here!
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 1 night stay at the hotel du vin. We arrived early and were allowed to check in early which was fantastic as we were going to newcastle races. The receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our room was amazing! I have my list of 'favourite hotels in the world' and this is definately up there. We stayed on a dinner bed and breakfast basis which was superb value. Dinner was great although perhaps a little pricey if you were having to pay for it. We will definately return soon.
reviews.title: Beautiful night away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel after researching hotels on Newcastle Quayside, whilst I'm from Newcastle I hadn't heard of it before and I was a little worried as the pictures of the hotel rooms seemed generic to the Hotel du Vin properties.
reviews.title: Birthday Suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had no need for any worries or concerns... we arrived on a beautiful Saturday July afternoon to the terrace buzzing with people and the music was in full swing and BBQ fired up.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, cannot fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having put 2 through Uni in Newcastle we have regularly stayed in this hotel. This visit was for our son's Graduation. I had initially booked in March, knowing that rooms get booked up for Grad week. By joining the Hotel Du Vin email list I was sent all the "new deals" and was able to shave £130 off the initial price and get breakfast thrown in (and what a breakfast!) There was no issue in cancelling and rebooking at the new rate which is such a relief.
reviews.title: Another fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set slightly out of the city near the quayside in an old shipbuilding yard. Rooms are quirky and beautifully decorated. Ours had a roll top bath in it this time, previously we've had mezzanine rooms which have a bathroom up on a balcony overlooking the bedroom. The rooms were a little cold as all the windows in the corridors had been left open - granted it's July but it was FREEZING outside! Quick fiddle with the air con sorted our room out. Coffee machines in the room as standard is a great touch, as are the mini milk bottles in the fridge.
reviews.title: New Year extravaganza...
Only 8th in Newcastle? I don't think so....
reviews.text: Breakfast is amazing - I think the bistro has been refitted and the leather covered chairs are super comfy. The kitchen is open and it's great to be able to watch the chefs making your breakfast, particularly while your husband ignores you and just reads the paper! Great choices, really lovely fresh warm croissants, freshly squeezed OJ, interesting fruit salad and muesli choices, and the full english is great with some of the best black pudding I've had in years. Having an open kitchen means you can thank the chef, who seemed really surprised that anyone would do that!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you can, try to get breakfast included in your rate.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay, Great Meal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ALSO, the Bistro in the evening is fabulous. Reading the menu online may not seem all that inspiring, but every time we have been up to Newcastle over the last 6 years we have eaten here. My starter was a special crab and chilli linguini - delish - and NO shell (we'd eaten at Cafe 21 the night before and I had loads of shell in my crab starter - complained about it and didn't even have the dish removed from the bill - RUBBISH service!). My husband had ordered a sirloin that was very sinewy and asked for it to be changed to a fillet, and it was without any fuss. My duck confit was absolutely divine, and the lemon tart - Oh My! Usually with a tart au citron it's a skinny little thing with a smear of lemon curd on some ropey pastry. This was about two inches deep of the most amazing light, lemony, cream concoction. Portions are enormous, the wine list is incredible - if you like deep interesting reds then have a go with the Mission Hill Pinot - it's one of the best wines I've had in a long time.
reviews.title: great hotel

aka: Hotel Du Vin And Bistro Newcastle
